questions.question: An accident, including continuous or repeated exposure to substantially the same general harmful conditions, describes:
options: An occurrence
An accident
Use and operation

questions.question: Under the Liability Section of a Habitational Form, for coverage to be provided for bodily injury or property damage it must be:
options: Sudden and unexpected
Occur over long periods of time
Continuous or repeated exposure
All of the above

questions.question: Exclusions under Coverage E, Liability insurance for Habitational Forms do NOT include:
options: Liability assumed under contract
Damage to property owned by Insured
Vacant land owned by the Insured in Canada
Damage to property used, rented, or in the care, custody, or control of the insured

questions.question: Under Coverage H of a Property Policy, Voluntary Compensation for Residence Employees, there is no coverage for:
options: Loss of life, including funeral benefits
Weekly indemnity
Medical expenses
Loss of wages of employee because they cannot work

questions.question: Liability for non-owned watercraft and motorized equipment is covered under a Homeowner’s Package policy. Which of the following is covered?
options: Watercraft used for carrying passengers for compensation
Use and operation of any type of watercraft subject to exclusions
Any self-propelled land vehicle provided vehicle is not subject to motor vehicle registration and is designated for use off public roads
While used in a race or speed test
A, B, and C
B and C
All of the above

questions.question: Your insured owns a cute and well-trained dog, but a neighbour continuously allows her dog to walk off-leash in your client’s cul-de-sac. How should your client manage their risk of being sued?
options: Install a fence with small enough gaps to keep their own dog from escaping and causing third-party damages
Sell your client a hobby-farm policy
Third-party liability does not cover damages caused by your insured animal, so no need to advise your client of any risk management technique
Install a fence with small enough gaps to keep the neighbour's dog from entering your insured's backyard
